title: Getting_started
text: developing modifications FRAM software, important confirm modified version FRAM behaves intended. key step compare output modified FRAM software output established FRAM software changes code affect output. example, developed version FRAM supports batch runs. case, changes FRAM actually ran individual models. Step 1 create two copies database, run runs one database using established FRAM software, run runs database using modified FRAM software. point, need compare run outputs . package streamlines process. flow fairly simple. Using framrsquared package connect FRAM databases. use compare_table_across_dbs() compare values table interest two databases. suggest Mortality table, mortality values , ERs . effect, function lines values run (ie, mortality values stock 1 fishery 1 timestep 1 age 3) compares . ideal world, see exact match values run established FRAM software new FRAM software (assuming, applied runs expect case). However, may situations expect results approximately exactly (e.g., mortalities unrelated stock attempt stock splitting – exactly , may see “decimal dust”). summarize_exact() summarize_ratio() make tables absolute differences proportional differences values, plot_comparisons_exact() plot_comparisons_ratio() create diagnostic plots . case databases Formal testing/coho_preseason_notamm_c.mdb Formal testing/coho_preseason_notamm_c.mdb, basic comparison might look like following. reminder, connect_fram_db give error filepath isn’t absolute; package provides absolute filepaths based current project. cases fisheries, stocks, runs expected identical two databases, can filtered outputs compare_table_across_dbs() running summarize_*() plot_comparisons_*().
code: library(framrsquared) library(tidyverse) library(framqaqc) library(here)  fram_a = connect_fram_db(here("Formal testing/coho_preseason_notamm_a.mdb"),                          read_only = TRUE,                          quiet = TRUE) fram_c = connect_fram_db(here("Formal testing/coho_preseason_notamm_c.mdb"),                          read_only = TRUE,                          quiet = TRUE)                           mortality_comparison = compare_table_across_dbs(fram_a, fram_c, "Mortality")  summarize_exact(mortality_comparison) #hopefully all 0s or close to 0 summarize_ratio(mortality_comparison) #hopefully all 1s or close to 1  plot_comparisons_exact(mortality_comparison) #hopefully all points are on or near the 1:1 line plot_comparisons_ratio(mortality_comparison) #hopefully all points are on or the y = 1 line  disconnect_fram_db(fram_a) disconnect_fram_db(fram_c)

text: fram_db_1 fram database connection first database (used reference ratio calculations) fram_db_2 fram database connection second database table_name Name table compare

title: Compare tables between two databases — compare_table_across_dbs
text: tibble comparisons, including run_id, appropriate stock_id, age, fishery_id, time_step. $db1 $db2 give values database column $metric; $diff_exact db1-db2, $diff_ratio db2/db1.

title: Compare tables between two databases — compare_table_across_dbs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ library(framrsquared) fram_a = connect_fram_db( "C:/Repos/fram multirun testing/Formal testing/coho_preseason_notamm_a.mdb", read_only = TRUE, quiet = TRUE) fram_c = connect_fram_db( "C:/Repos/fram multirun testing/Formal testing/coho_preseason_notamm_c.mdb",                         read_only = TRUE,                        quiet = TRUE) compare_table_across_dbs(fram_a, fram_c, "Mortality") disconnect_fram_db(fram_a) disconnect_fram_db(fram_b) } # }

what: Plot the values of the two databases against each other — plot_comparisons_exact
title: Plot the values of the two databases against each other — plot_comparisons_exact
text: Creates faceted plots based output compare_table_across_dbs(), values one database plotted corresponding values . two databases exactly , points fall 1:1 line; dashed 1:1 line included reference. improve performance, avoids plotting duplicate near-duplicate entries. "near-duplicate" controlled argument round_digits.

title: Plot the values of the two databases against each other — plot_comparisons_exact
Plot the values of the two databases against each other — plot_comparisons_exact
text: tab tibble produced compare_table_across_dbs(). round_digits Digits round identifying entries "near-duplicate" entries. Defaults 0 (e.g., round nearest fish). Appropriate reduce comparing tables values much smaller.

title: Plot the values of the two databases against each other — plot_comparisons_exact
text: ggplot object

what: Plot the ratios of database comparisons — plot_comparisons_ratio
title: Plot the ratios of database comparisons — plot_comparisons_ratio
text: Creates faceted plots based output compare_table_across_dbs(), ratio db2/db1 plotted values db1. two databases exactly , points ratio exactly 1; dashed horizontal line 1 included reference. improve performance, avoids plotting duplicate near-duplicate entries. "near-duplicate" values db1 controlled argument round_digits; ratio values within 0.001 treated near-duplicate.

title: Plot the ratios of database comparisons — plot_comparisons_ratio
Plot the ratios of database comparisons — plot_comparisons_ratio
text: tab tibble produced compare_table_across_dbs(). round_digits digits round db1 order avoid plotting near-duplicate points.

title: Plot the ratios of database comparisons — plot_comparisons_ratio

title: Summarize exact differences from compare_table_across_dbs() — summarize_exact
text: Makes quick summary outputs compare_table_across_dbs(), giving min, max, 0.01 0.99 quantiles absolute differences values run id. perfect match values 0.

what: Summarize ratio differences from compare_table_across_dbs() — summarize_ratio
title: Summarize ratio differences from compare_table_across_dbs() — summarize_ratio
text: Makes quick summary outputs compare_table_across_dbs(), giving min, max, 0.01 0.99 quantiles ratio values db2 / db1, run id. Ignore entries values <=1 db1 avoid divide--zero issues inflation small differences.
